reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 343/94: PROVINCIALLY APPROVED SCREENING DEVICES
reg_info.act_under: Highway Traffic Act   Code de la route

content.content: 1. The following devices are prescribed as provincially approved screening devices for the purposes of section 48.1 of the Act: 1. An “approved screening device” as defined in the Criminal Code (Canada). 2. A screening device that meets the standards of the Alcohol Test Committee of the Canadian Society of Forensic Sciences. O.Reg. 343/94, s.1.
content.raw_html:
1. The following devices are prescribed as provincially approved screening devices for the purposes of section 48.1 of the Act:

1. An “approved screening device” as defined in the Criminal Code (Canada).

2. A screening device that meets the standards of the Alcohol Test Committee of the Canadian Society of Forensic Sciences. O.Reg. 343/94, s.1.

content.content: 2. A provincially approved screening device shall be calibrated so that when a breath sample that is alcohol free is tested, the device does not give a reading or result greater than three milligrams of alcohol in 100 millilitres of blood. O. Reg. 343/94, s. 2.
content.raw_html: 2. A provincially approved screening device shall be calibrated so that when a breath sample that is alcohol free is tested, the device does not give a reading or result greater than three milligrams of alcohol in 100 millilitres of blood. O. Reg. 343/94, s. 2.

content.content: 3. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation). O.Reg. 343/94, s. 3.
content.raw_html: 3. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation). O.Reg. 343/94, s. 3.
